description: From Middle English reciten, from Old French reciter, from Latin recitare.

verbs.description: recite (third-person singular simple present recites, present participle reciting, simple past and past participle recited)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To repeat aloud (some passage, poem or other text previously memorized, or in front of one's eyes), often before an audience.
examples: Janice is able to recite pi to 100 decimals.
